p: All the plant species had high mineral contents and can be used as a good source for medicines ( Table 5). A total of 13 different elements were quantitatively analyzed in all the five plant species. Among the major elements, carbon was maximum (70.25%) in R. officinalis and minimum (56.2%) in M. piperita, while only nitrogen was absent in R. officinalis. In minor elements, chlorine was found highest (1.09%) in Mentha spicata and lowest (0.19%) in R. officinalis (Figures 4 and 5) . O. basilicum and M. longifolia had high calcium content which plays a key role in bone formation [ 35]. M. longifolia had the highest potassium concentration which plays a key part of many enzymes' synthesis and plays a vital role in the activation of growth of enzymes [ 36, 37]. Arika et al. [ 24] and Gogoasa et al. [ 25] had reported C, N, O, Mg, K, P, S, Ca, Al, Si, Fe, Cl, and Na elements in Mentha species, Ocimum species, and in Rosmarinus species.
